caption.title:
Epidemiological dynamics on heterogeneous spatial configurations of target cells randomly generated with varying pair correlation p
CC but fixed mean density of target cell x
C = 0.5.
caption.p:
Each column denotes the configuration for p
CC = 0.1 (a, d, g), p
CC = 0.25 which corresponds to complete spatial randomness (b, e, h), and p
CC = 0.4 (c, f, i). (a-c) Examples of spatial structure, where target cells are shown in white. (d-f) The regions in the parameter space of recovery rate ( α) and the proportion of global infection ( G) in which viruses are either maintained in endemic equilibrium (shaded) or go extinct (white). The endemic condition is obtained by Eq ( 7). (g-i) The results of Monte-Carlo simulation showing the fraction of trials in 20 independent simulation runs in which viruses didn’t become extinct until 500 time steps as a function G. The recovery rate is fixed at α = 4 (g, h), or α = 5.5 (i). Other parameters are β
G = β
L = 10.
